# Science Communication & Public Engagement

Translating complex biomedical research into accessible narratives — without compromising rigor, and occasionally with a well-placed sense of humor.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Timeline of Talks & Public Engagement

::::::::: timeline
### 2026

::: timeline-item
###      \ **Festival of Consciousness (FOC 2026)** 
10–12 July 2026 

### \ Brain-Body Integromics of the Ayahuasca Experience

A scientific presentation exploring altered states of consciousness through integrative metabolomics, neuroimaging and systems-level modeling. The talk connected subjective experience with measurable biological dynamics.

<https://thefestivalofconsciousness.org/>

![](images/divulgacion/foc.jpg){width="60%" height="60%"}
:::

::: timeline-item
###  \ **Pint of Science 2026 – Barcelona** 20 May 2026 

### \ La Bioquímica del Bienestar

An accessible yet rigorous discussion of stress hormones, emotional regulation and the biological foundations of well-being. A reminder that neurotransmitters are not mystical — but they are fascinating.

<https://pintofscience.es/>

![](images/divulgacion/pinta.png){width="30%" height="25%"}
:::

::: timeline-item
###  \ El cuerpo también es arquitectura

Centro Cívico Joan Oliver – Pere Quart\
13 May 2026

A joint lecture examining how urban design shapes emotional regulation and brain function. We discussed how the built environment becomes biologically embedded.
:::

::: timeline-item
###  \ Modulación emocional en el estrés urbano barcelonés

Centro Cívico Can Deu\
3 June 2026

An exploration of chronic urban stress and endocrine regulation, integrating neuroscience with lived urban experience.
:::

##  \ Consciousness, Emotions & Neurobiology

###  \ Las emociones de Pinocho  
**AFAMMCA – Associació de Familiars de Malalts Mentals de Catalunya**  
19 & 24 February 2026  

A workshop exploring emotional regulation, trauma and resilience through narrative and neuroscience. Using the metaphor of Pinocchio, the session translated complex neurobiological concepts into relatable human experiences.  

[AFAMMCA](https://www.afammca.org/)


![](images/divulgacion/Pinocho_color.png){width="40%" height="40%"}
:::
